description: Displays details about an event bus in your account. This can include the external Amazon Web Services accounts that are permitted to write events to your default event bus, and the associated policy. For custom event buses and partner event buses, it displays the name, ARN, policy, state, and creation time. To enable your account to receive events from other accounts on its default event bus, use PutPermission. For more information about partner event buses, see CreateEventBus.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the event bus. Currently, this is always default.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the account permitted to write events to the current account.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyIdentifier
nested_items.description: The identifier of the KMS customer managed key for EventBridge to use to encrypt events on this event bus, if one has been specified.

nested_items.name: DeadLetterConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration details of the Amazon SQS queue for EventBridge to use as a dead-letter queue (DLQ).

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the SQS queue specified as the target for the dead-letter queue.

nested_items.name: Policy
nested_items.description: The policy that enables the external account to send events to your account.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: The time the event bus was created.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedTime
nested_items.description: The time the event bus was last modified.
